verbatim_example: What I'm wondering is how long after my last dose of bupe will it be before it is again effective for a rapid opiates detox?
My question, to the socially adept of us here, is - how do you socialize with people? How do you stay socially relevant while dealing with this problem?
Do I just force myself to go to meetings *again*? I've been before and doubt myself so much.

I'm going through some emotional process I feel lost and afraid because I haven't got a clue what is going on or when it will end. Every significant emotional difficulty feels like the end of the world! ... Those dark moments come with suicidal ideation and using thoughts - although more of the former than the latter.

I have to start working again, but I'm not sure if I can wait till I'm off Kratom too. A part of me thinks getting on a routine would be good for me even if I have to eventually deal with Kratom W/Ds while working.
I would love to stop it all but I'm living alone and not working, not having a distraction or something to normalize my routine makes withdrawal 10x's worse.
This time I avoided any phone calls that I knew would get to me, but my dad knows something is up and just pray he doesn't drive up (I live an hour away).

Now after 3 weeks I am back in that place I was months ago. Sometimes I think a work routine, being around co-workers, etc will be good to establish before jumping off all the way. Basically use Kratom like suboxone.
I wanna beat his ass, I wanna make sure he's okay, I wanna be there for him while he has no one at this shelter 100's of miles from home.
I've only got 5 months but I'm telling you. I'm so excited to wake up each day doing something I love. Helping other addicts who are suffering.
How can I get the best bang for my buck with them? I'd usually take 2 and snort a half of one for a fast, hard come up and a pretty long high. Is there's a better way for me to dose these?
I got my hands on some 300/30 APAP codeines and was wondering how many I would have to CWE to get a buzz going

Started with Narco 10s in highschool, worked my way up to pink oxys, then A 214s, then A 215s, and you know how it goes. Now I'm in college and I love the rush and buzz from railing a roxy and popping 2 more,
haven't had any opis in months
A match made in heaven when I'm high
Steal of the week: 22 15mg oxy's for $80
What can I do to make it thru detox without killing myself (or really wanting to).
I still haven't had the withdrawals I was expecting, no shitting water, no puking, no seizures (from benzo wd), no sweats. The wrestless legs still won't quit.
I've done pt, that didn't work. I got a massage four days ago, and that made it worse.
I am scared bc I know I will want to use. I am scared bc I know I can walk into the er and get a shot of Dilaudid and a script for Vicodin.
I don't even remember how it's done. I am happy to be here, sober .

I've never used a needle. Why? Seriously. I just want a "normal" friend. I've never been friends with another addict, but I am so damn lonely. This is just so tempting. Just for today, I will not relapse. What about tomorrow tho.
Every year, Ive celebrated by getting as high as possible. Not this year. I celebrated by not using.
7 grams of some of the dopest dope I've ever shoved in a syringe.
This is the only period of sobriety I've had in 10 years. If I can do it, any of you guys can.
I used to run one in r/opiates but figured I could get some people who actually could participate in the entire season through this sub.
If I can do it any of you can. Do what works for you.
It's day 3 off of a 8 day relapse. Came clean to everyone I know (all very supportive) Been a closet oxy user for years... had some good clean time before lapsing the last 8 days prior to Saturday.
Eight days down, moving into day 9. Not as cool as r/The_Motel 's 112 but better than nothing.

I'm still a lot of things that fuckin suck... BUT I'm noticing glimmers. Sometimes they come and go in an instant, sometimes they stick around a few minutes, sometimes I can stretch them for 1-2 hours. Piece by piece, glimmer by glimmer, I'm working to rebuild.

This shit isn't easy... but that shouldn't be the reason you don't stop using. It's not supposed to be easy, you're trying to rescue your hijacked brain and body from something that's held it hostage for however long.
Eventually I replied to him with the supportive route and asked him what his plan was to get a handle on himself again,

Still some morning GI stuff. Clams come and go. Energy/happiness comes in more spurts with less feelings of gloom and doom. I feel like I'm trying to slowly step back into the shell of my old self that I've been hovering outside of for the last year.
Symptoms at 3 weeks out... broken sleep of 4-6 hours, morning shits (a very zen one this morning at least), anhedonia waves, come and go restless limbs.
Sunday morning the fog rolled back in. Emotional, tons of GI issues, anxiety sweats, depressed, stir crazy, irritable, restless. Felt like day 4 of withdrawals out of the blue.
Only things lingering around at 25 days are morning GI, restless sleep, anxiety/anhedonia waves. I think it's gradually getting better but it feels sort of consistent over the last few days.
I've now gone five days without, and I can't help but think, fuck it, one more time, whats the big deal? Ill be gone soon anyway with no connects so what can happen??
Day 2. I'm struggling. But better than expected. If I don't make it I'll lose everything.
I think I can do this. I haven't thought that in a long time even when I made it to three days before.
Thats enough. I cant fucking do that anymore. It is humiliating. Degrading. I dont want in the least to be that person.
This is the longest I've been sober in a year at least.
I had a major car accident and relapsed. In back to 3days. Need encouragement.
All you guys and gals.... Stick with it. I was hopeless. If I can do it, you can.
Just because we're addicts doesn't mean we need to go through withdrawals.

But, this time I fucked up. As I finish off a bag of poppyseeds, I go to check my emergency supply and find out I only have FIVE POUNDS LEFT! Which is maybe 5 days worth of tea if I really stretch it and taper down. My next shipment wasn't supposed to arrive until 2 weeks later. I'm thinking
I'm going to get totally straight hamstered! (This post is about getting high, not recovering from addiction)
I've tried to quit 5 times in the last year or so. Start a program, leave the program. Get through detox, feel great and then "just for the weekend" myself back into active addiction.
I'm actually looking forward to it, rather than mocking the whole process. The days where I feel out of control and anxious are farther and farther apart.
I know that there is no chance in hell that I can have any opiates without coming unhinged.
I was terrified and excited and all of the feelings. I reached out... I made a very big deal out of this appointment, which I discovered was simply my addiction rearing its head.
I'm writing this and calling my sponsor today so that I'm honest, and keeping myself accountable... But, guys... if I had them, they would be 100% gone. Which makes me feel like shit.
What am I supposed to do? I know that I am a fucking jackass when it comes to this shit, but it isn't until the evening when I realize I can't live this way.
I finally was honest with myself about this fact, and have been trying so, so hard to get a truly good amount of time together.
I encourage anyone who wants to make that change to realize that you already do know, in your heart, that you are fully capable of changing.

Myself as well as the large majority of opiate users I have met along my journey through recovery all have almost the same story. Got injured in some way, got prescribed Vicodin, Percocet, Oxys, even fucking Fentanyl in some cases- and then, after unknowingly becoming physically dependent on the medication (which the doctors often failed to warn about), the doc suddenly ends the script.

I just want to write this so that those who are in the state and/or timeframe that I was in at this point two years ago to know that it gets so, so much better. Unfortunately, time away from the game and everything involved with it is another very important factor and it feels unfair, because time is not something that we can manipulate (as we are all so well versed in doing one way or another) and b/c of that it is frustrating and almost can feel futile.
Clean for over two years... Why am I still searching this shit.
These movies all make me want to get high. I've been clean for two years, but have been jonesin hard lately...
I feel like if I shot a bag of the bullshit ECP in my neck of the woods, I would be so disappointed I wasted two years of sobriety on that though.
For all the people in early recovery, don't complain about rehab, sober living, or meetings. Enjoy it, have fun, cherish the people you are meeting and create lifelong connections.
Big fan of the tan, hate white dope

Call me a junkie while I slap my monkey . - This post title contains language that implies opiate use ('junkie') and references the physical symptoms of withdrawal ('slap my monkey'), which is slang for 'kicking the habit' or experiencing withdrawal.
Jokes about sourcing/ giving away pills
For those who liked my dope porn yesterday... $180 .

The user mentions 'nods' which is slang for heroin/opiate use, indicating they are currently using opiates. Additionally, the post title explicitly states their intention to engage in opiate use over a weekend.
Please. If you're thinking of trying heroin please please please do not do it. It's not fun anymore. Please don't do it. Please listen to the good people here who tell you not to fuck with it.

I really wish I was normal, and could use here and there without totally destroying everything I've worked for. My life is moving in such a positive direction, but of course with my thought process I'm trying to devise a plan for when I'm through with the court system so I can use in moderation, and sell on the side again.

Iâ€™m also currently in sober living due to my conditions of release/deferred disposition and will have just over 2 years clean when I can leave here. Iâ€™m fully aware itâ€™s a stupid idea to even attempt to use after that long but if I were to ever do it again, Iâ€™d like to know what other people do.

Thereâ€™s a part of me that really does want to stay clean, but a stronger side thatâ€™s telling me I can manage using again. I keep telling myself it was never that bad, and I didnâ€™t use long enough, or my bottom wasnâ€™t low enough.
It is very tempting to go back.
Day 16 without heroin. Im feeling ok other than that damn depression that feels like its going to stay forever!
Today is day 17 without heroin. Its been a struggle im still struggling with the mental sides of things and the depression but im ok i guess
I no i need to pick myself up as soon as i can.
Im 1 week heroin free. Not feel well today
Today i am 15 days off heroin. Feeling depressed still but im waiting to hear back from doctor about antidepressants.
I want to celebrate but am unsure of how to.
This post likely wont be long as my focus isnt the best. I no i ahouldnt have gone back.
Im on day two without heroin. I been in the bathroom all day puking and shitting. When i try to eat or drink liquids all i do is puke them back up.
I am day 10 off heroin and alcohol been in hospital (was brought in there the other day) for dehydration and withdrawals.
I am 23 days off alcohol and 27 off Heroin. That is good as i plan to keep the days going up :)
I am day 8 off heroin, ... Back on the Road to Recovery
Because it was a court ordered rehab if i fail a drug test then ill be headed for prison for awhile.
You know in recovery, how they talk about that moment where it clicks? Well I had one of those.  At that moment, nothing mattered except for recovery.

With only 60 days clean myself, I think I'm a little jealous that other opiate addicts are still using mind altering chemicals. In some weird way, I wish I could sill drink or smoke or take other pills, and those suppressed longings are turning into something different.
Just curious to know how many meetings do you go to per week (if any), and how much clean time do you have?
"Must Not Sleepâ€¦ must warn others"- I got this cause to me it's about staying self aware and in the moment which is a huge part of recovery and growing as a person.
The whole one year rule is in the back of my mind. How can I expect someone to be where I need them to be, if I'm not where I need me to be? I've just gotten 90 days 100% sober this week.
Life keeps on getting better. My life is filled with so much love instead of the bullshit it was filled with for so long.
After a bad relapse, I found myself hopeless and ended up at the tables as a last resort. I didn't know what else to do.

What made me want to change for the better was being in the ER after almost over dosing on heroin and acting very belligerent towards my mom. To this day I still have no idea what I said or did that caused her to call the cops.

I still feel like I'm missing something. I guess I am still addicted to chaos. This does not mean that I'm not grateful for everything that I now have, I just really feel like I'm a ticking time bomb and that in any second I'll just go back to my old ways.
I just wanted to tell you guys that this is my first sober Halloween in 5 years!

To anyone who is in early recovery, I want to tell you that it is possible to enjoy life without drugs. I didn't believe it was possible a few months ago but as time went on and I began going to meetings and realizing what life was really about was when I became happier.
Before my relapse 1 and 1/2 years ago, I had almost three years clean and I can honestly say Iâ€™m much happier now because I addressed problems Iâ€™ve always had.
Is U-47700 worth getting my hands on? I'd be injecting.
I ask how much for the 30's and he said $18 a piece!!!
I'm baaaack! Not that anyone noticed I was even gone lmao. Plus a little dope tease

So of course we look to see if it contains any goodies (we always look lmao) and there in the bag, was fucking 3 grams of crack!!!! We snatched that shit up so quick and went straight to the dope boys spot.

I've been an IV heroin & coke aka speedball user for 4 years now and have relapsed over 5 times. Ive overdosed 1 time and also had cellulitis in my arm from dirty needles. Been arrested once before for drugs as well as been banned from retail stores for shoplifting. Stolen thousands of dollars from my family and former employers. Have almost 15 days clean now and I notice recovery has been getting harder and harder for me the more i relapse.
I'm aware of how much getting involved with girls and relationships can mess with a persons head during the first year of recovery. I relapsed because a relationship ended badly.
UPDATE: I've decided to keep the pills, but I'm going to slow down and think for a while before I decide whether or not to try it again.

I've decided to quit opiates starting tomorrow after eight months of use, the last four of which were fairly heavy (3-4 large doses of heroin a day with smaller doses in between). Hopefully I'll be able to keep this up, if anyone has suggestions on how to keep busy and start enjoying everyday activities again I'd love to hear them!

For all of you who've decided to as of tomorrow, good for you and feel free to PM me if you need something or just want to talk to someone. I'm currently finishing up my fifth day sober-ish (on xanax rn) and through the worst of the physical WDs.
I had no urge to buy today, but as soon as I had the pills in front of me I broke. Fuck I was doing so well, was already through the worst of the WDs.
I've gone through WDs before, but I always crack as soon as I have access to opiates again. I really want to STAY clean this time, and I'm hoping some of you guys will have advice on how to do so.
Just had myself a fat 3AM line.
I'm so excited to rail one of those little orange fuckers. Any dose recommendations if I do about a point of good dope at a time?
I'm about 3 weeks sober and im really considering buying some dope because I need that rush. All I want is a bump. A line. A shot. All I want is to be numb.
I have 2.5 more blues and they'll probably be gone by midnight.
What does everyone here think? It would absolutely crush my family if they knew I relapsed, and it doesn't seem like enough of a setback to count it as one, but I don't know. Any advice?

Yesterday I slipped and railed a qg of coke...I immediately washed out my nose and regretted it. What does everyone here think? It would absolutely crush my family if they knew I relapsed, and it doesnâ€™t seem like enough of a setback to count it as one, but I donâ€™t know.

I feel that going through the withdrawals combined with not having any crutches will give me some enlightenment and allow me to completely focusing on recovery instead of worrying about my next nic fix.

I used yesterday for the first time in 119 days, and again this morning.

It's actually really bad, it's been constantly in the back of my mind and just won't shut up. sometimes lately I'm catching myself just day dreaming about it and just reminiscing back to the warmth once it enters he blood stream. This is the first time it's lasted this long (the craving) and I just want to know how some of you get through that.
I don't know what it is but I am feeling extremely hopeless right now. Like nothing's going right.
I waited to post this to make sure I go through the month. Even though it has been a tough couple years for me I've managed to stay strong and for the most part positive.
Slowly saving back up to rebuild it now that I'm sober.
Y'all all on that sour candy shit and I'm just over here on a whole nother level .
After a 3 month dry spell I got to pick up.

I know about the insomnia, and the RLS, and the aches, and the sweats, and the depression, and the anxiety, as this is not my first time being without the drug, but my first time I do not intend to use at my first opportunity in a while.
To all reading this looking for help or inspiration you CAN do it, trust me if I can, anyone can.
Does anyone think this is related to the opiate quitting again? I plan on seeing a psych the week after this,
Hoping I didn't do any permanent damage and it will come back. Second issue is my guts.  I have like 3 out of 10 nausea all day and haven't had a solid movement in 10 days(used Lope taper to quit.)
I have the worst headache of my life achey and chilly, when I'm not feeling on fire. My guts also are, not great.

I've been super depressed the past few days (went from my normal 4-5/10 to 8/10), could this be a symptom of PAWS? Also I'm considering going back on welbutrin which has helped me in past clean periods. Question is, will this affect my PAWS timeline?
Throwing this out there for advice, encouragement, and the sense of community I craved and needed when first getting clean.

After ~3 seconds where I almost started salivating and sneezing(I sneeze when I get high for some reason) I let the thought process and was disgusted. Told him I didn't and no thank you, and to watch out with those, because I've seen them ruin lives and I like the kid.
I'm also ice cold, is that a withdrawal thing? ... Cloudy head and jumpy jittery chicken sizzle muscles, no appetite so I'm weak, and holy crap, does anyone else have a backache from hell?
Hold on guys, we can kick this shit!
I promise myself that after the hell of withdrawal I will never go down that road again.
Three weeks ago I was in hell. My body went through an absolute horror show of pain. Fever, shakes, nausea, muscle cramps... insomnia, jesus.
I think about using and reason it out. It makes no sense to go back.
I have been clean for ten weeks and three days -- I genuinely lost track. Life got busy, and I'm okay, and I've thought about it, and been tempted, but I'm still here.
I actually asked them to move the bottles. I wanted to yell "Put that away! I'm doing well but holy hell, a person can only take so much before they'll snap!"
I do want to say there was a time in my addiction that I would cry leaving the block and think to myself "why do I keep doing this?"
We never used together but we were both hopeless dope fiends at the same time but never talked. I got sober in 2014. A year later we reconnected. I helped get him County funding to get into rehab.
I was addicted to heroin again after my first stint in rehab got me almost 6 months of sobriety.

Does anyone know of any programs that can help? Never been homeless and not sure what to do.
Why can't we fucking get real dope, I have been using for the last 10 years but only Dope the last 3-4 but I have never experienced this insanity. What the FUCK are they putting in this shit.
I just don't have the money for it right now. Knowing as soon as I get some money I am going to be tempted to pick up again.
Picked up today for the first time in a while. I'm a newbie to the game so I took 20mg oxy and a Tylenol 3 and I'm feeling good.
I want to want to get clean but it's hard to see it. I haven't used since the day but the cravings have been there 24/7.
I haven't touched an opiate in almost 5 months. While not a long time in the grand scheme of things, it's something that I'm proud of.
I really really want to use again.

She feels like she can't live without it at least once or twice a week, which I told her was fine as long as she doesn't go overboard. What scares me is how fanatical she gets about the stuff when she's craving, as if it's the only thing that can make her happy.

it's about my mindset when I was using

I'm over the worst why go right back. I'm just feeling trapped and depressed.
I have a long way to go I know. But it does feel good to not have opiates pumping through me.
Feeling sooo much better. Sleep is still shit. But hit a meeting last night, great topics. Feeling good today, hopeful. Conversations are easier, crawling my ass out of bed is easier.

Didn't get to spend much time with her, but the joy I saw on her face when I wished her a happy birthday before anything else and her knowing it was sincere and that I am sober was great motivation for the day. And her saying I gave her the greatest birthday gift by being sober.
Stay clean. Shit tends to work out in the end.
I genuinely feel like I'm almost back to who I was before the opiates took over my life. And this goes out to anyone out there who knows they need to bite the bullet.
Took the subs for 7 days, still felt a bit strange during that time. Probably the kratom withdrawal under the subs.

To anyone out there who is on day 1 week 1 week 2 etc. I know how INSURMOUNTABLE it seems. But I PROMISE YOU if you just STAY THE FUCK AWAY FROM OPIATES, and have a vision of what you want your life to look like. It WILL fall into place.
I ran out of my meds soon after I got out and am continuing to heal up, find a job and change my life around. It's been 4 days since I did any opiates and hope I can continue to stay sober.
I figured it was time to stop. Lope definitely helped my withdrawals the first three days and then when I woke up on the 4th day, I felt completely fine.

Starting all over now. Day 3. My withdrawals are never really that bad besides the sleep problem but I just take two extremely high doses of loperamide each 48 hours apart and before I know it i'm clear of the withdrawals...

I will go to outpatient and meetings as much as I can. Just got my second DWAI before rehab and lost my license so it will be hard but I need to take my time and slowly reintegrate into society so the stress does not overwhelm me.
I have meditated on and off, usually when I had a steady supply of heroin. Was doing a bundle a day but now im 24 days clean
I know I don't want too and I geniuely feel horrible for what I've done in the past. I feel like my soul is still gone in a way.
I would not have been outside and saw that duck if the cosmos did not align in such a way for me to stay sober now for 6 weeks and 3 days.

I remember endless aching Timeless nights spent sleepless, taking anything to stop the shaking, Anything i'd found Thinking nothing, feeling hollow planning all the highs to follow all the pain and pills to swallow stolen; hidden; downed I remember darkness creeping up and out and sinking, seeping crying in the night and sleeping lost without a sound
I was thinking of a podcast design where I have recovering addicts give their life story in a tri weekly podcast type set up.

Someone save me if you will
And take away all these pills
Guilt, shame, stress, and fear
I've choose this life and left those near
I would have gotten nowhere the past 3 years if I didn't stop.

Off to rehab tomorrow, I have done everything to get clean the last 6 months, but after a few years of shootn dope every day, I am too deep in to make it to the other side by myself. So I went home to my parents and told them everything and tomorrow I am off to rehab.
I survived day 1 (today) easy, I have no idea why I tried to do it myself 50 times when I should have come here right away.
I want to listen to others that tried and fucked up, how and why did it happen, also if someone managed to stick to it, how do you stay strong and did you exp some negative consequences?
The problem tho is that I have had mild withdrawals after that. How is that even possible?

So far I made it about two and a half days, last dose was Wednesday afternoon. I actually caved Friday morning and went to my guy and ended getting beat, the bags were 95% percent cut, I was just as sick after snorting it as I was before the fact.

I need to open up to people a lot more about how I feel and that Iâ€™m struggling. Today is day 1 after coming off a two week run. Any idea on what to expect for withdrawal from only a 2 week run? Will it be just as bad when I came off my 5 month run?
Iâ€™ve must of tried atleast 15-20 times to quit since I relapsed and only made it through WD once and relapsed again after 2 weeks.
I am not going to go back and accept I made a mistake but did I just put myself back at day one again of withdraws?

I did manage to get 8 hours last night because I took 60mg of melatonin (which Iâ€™m sure is not healthy) but woke up feeling like I slammed a handle of jack daniels the previous night. And I can only do that on nights I donâ€™t have work the next day.

Iâ€™ve been clean for 2 weeks and relapsed last night by snorting two stamp bags of heroin (ecp). Im just chulking it up as a one night thing and will continue to stay clean going forward and hopefully learn from this slip up. Iâ€™ve been done the physical withdraws for like a week now, will this one night cause bad physical withdrawals again after being two weeks clean or will I just have that hangover feeling and feel tired and groggy for a few days?
What do you do to stay clean? Just relapsed for the 2nd time in 3 weeks.
Iâ€™m going to try to quit again at home yet AGAIN but if it fails Iâ€™m going to try to get into rehab yet AGAIN.

Im 24 hours in right now and feel quite terrible. My dealer always told me if I ever wanted to quit he would completely cut me off and I finally gave him the word and he completely cut me off lol. Something I could never do even in my other quit attempts so I guess Iâ€™m all in this time.
